alert.note: Alert for Laramie; Platte (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 29 at 4:04PM MDT until June 29 at 4:15PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LARAMIE AND SOUTHEASTERN PLATTE COUNTIES... At 403 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Chugwater, or 31 miles southeast of Wheatland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Laramie and southeastern Platte Counties. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 34 and 59. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
